item.title: Human-Level and Beyond: Benchmarking Large Language Models Against Clinical Pharmacists in Prescription Review
item.description: arXiv:2512.02024v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) has accelerated their integration into clinical decision support, particularly in prescription review. To enable systematic and fine-grained evaluation, we developed RxBench, a comprehensive benchm...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, LLM, fine-tuning, model, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: The 4/$\delta$ Bound: Designing Predictable LLM-Verifier Systems for Formal Method Guarantee
item.description: arXiv:2512.02080v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The idea of using Formal Verification tools with large language models (LLMs) has enabled scaling software verification beyond manual workflows. However, current methods remain unreliable. Without a solid theoretical footing, the refinement process ca...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, experiment, LLM, model, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: STRIDE: A Systematic Framework for Selecting AI Modalities - Agentic AI, AI Assistants, or LLM Calls
item.description: arXiv:2512.02228v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid shift from stateless large language models (LLMs) to autonomous, goal-driven agents raises a central question: When is agentic AI truly necessary? While agents enable multi-step reasoning, persistent memory, and tool orchestration, deploying...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, LLM, reasoning, memory, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. item.title: Opening the Black Box: An Explainable, Few-shot AI4E Framework Informed by Physics and Expert Knowledge for Materials Engineering
item.description: arXiv:2512.02057v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The industrial adoption of Artificial Intelligence for Engineering (AI4E) faces two fundamental bottlenecks: scarce high-quality data and the lack of interpretability in black-box models-particularly critical in safety-sensitive sectors like aerospace...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, experiment, model, few-shot, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 80%</small>

item.title: An Improved Ensemble-Based Machine Learning Model with Feature Optimization for Early Diabetes Prediction
item.description: arXiv:2512.02023v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Diabetes is a serious worldwide health issue, and successful intervention depends on early detection. However, overlapping risk factors and data asymmetry make prediction difficult.
